title: JioTag Go launched as India’s first tracker on Google’s Find My Device Network: Steps to set up the devic - The Times of India
summary:
JioTag Go launched as India’s first tracker on Google’s Find My Device Network: Steps to set up the device

Publication Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

The JioTag Go is introduced as India's first tracking device integrated with Google’s Find My Device Network, providing users with enhanced tracking capabilities.

  • JioTag Go allows users to track lost items using their smartphones.
  • The device is designed for ease of use and integrates seamlessly with Google’s ecosystem.
  • Setting up JioTag Go involves simple steps outlined by the manufacturer.
“With JioTag Go, we aim to deliver innovative solutions to our customers to help them keep track of their belongings easily.”

The launch of the JioTag Go signifies a leap in personal tracking technology in India, making it a valuable tool for many users.

summary:
WhatsApp Expands Features with In-App Dialer and Group Mentions in Status

Publication Date: December 2024 Source: India TV News

WhatsApp continues to enhance its user experience with two new features aimed at improving the way users interact with the app. The updates include the ability to mention groups in status and an in-app dialer for iPhone users.

  • The new group mention feature in status updates allows users to address entire groups without tagging members individually.
  • This feature is currently in beta testing for Android users and is expected to launch for all by January 2025.
  • The in-app dialer for iPhone allows users to make calls directly from WhatsApp without saving contacts first, simplifying the calling process.
“This enhancement is set to make calling more convenient for everyone.”

WhatsApp's ongoing enhancements aim to improve communication across its platform, making everyday interactions smoother and more efficient.

OnePlus 13, OnePlus 13R India Launch Date Officially Confirmed

Date: January 7, 2025 | Source: Zee News

The OnePlus 13 series, including the OnePlus 13 and OnePlus 13R, is set to launch globally with a special event in India.

  • The launch event will commence at 9:00 pm IST on January 7, 2025, coinciding with OnePlus's 11th anniversary.
  • The smartphones will be available via Amazon and OnePlus India e-store.
  • Globally, the OnePlus 13 has already been released in China.
  • The expected price for OnePlus 13 is around Rs 65,000.
  • Specifications include a 6.82-inch Quad-HD+ AMOLED display, Snapdragon 8 Elite SoC, and a triple camera setup.
“The event will be live-streamed on OnePlus’s official channels.”

For more updates, stay tuned to official sources regarding the OnePlus 13 series.

title: iPhone 17 Air to launch next year: India price, specs and more - India Today
summary:
iPhone 17 Air to Launch Next Year: India Price, Specs and More

Publication Date: N/A Source: India Today

The iPhone 17 Air is expected to launch alongside the iPhone 17 and 17 Pro models, replacing the Plus model, with speculations of a September 2025 launch.

  • The iPhone 17 Air is anticipated to feature a thinner battery due to new electric glue technology, which will allow for a slimmer profile.
  • This new battery tech may help reduce the iPhone's weight and thickness, making it the slimmest iPhone yet.
  • Rumors suggest it may not come with a SIM tray, utilizing space for a thinner design.
  • All iPhone 17 models are rumored to support 120Hz ProMotion displays for improved scrolling and responsiveness.
  • Performance improvements with an upgraded chipset are expected, making it more powerful than the iPhone 16 Plus.
  • The estimated price of the iPhone 17 Air in India could be around Rs 89,900.
“The iPhone 17 Air might not even come with a SIM tray.”

This upcoming model promises a sleek design and advanced features, setting a new standard for smartphones in the market.
newTitle: iPhone 17 Air to Launch Next Year: India Price, Specs and More

title: OpenAI challenges Google: ChatGPT Search now free for all users - India TV News
summary:
OpenAI Challenges Google: ChatGPT Search Now Free for All Users

Publication Date: December 2024 | Source: India TV News

OpenAI, one of the most popular chatbot's founding companies has intensified competition with Google by making its ChatGPT Search feature free. This AI-powered search engine is now accessible to all users, promising to revolutionize online search.

  • ChatGPT Search, launched in November 2024, was initially for paid users only.
  • The feature is now free, positioning it as a direct competitor to Google.
  • It offers a user-friendly interface with direct answers and sources for queries.
  • OpenAI has introduced advanced voice mode for hands-free operation.
  • A map feature has been integrated, allowing users to locate nearby places.
  • Continuous updates aim to enhance user experience and functionality.
“The free availability of ChatGPT Search…could significantly disrupt the dominance of traditional search engines like Google.”

This move by OpenAI represents a significant shift in the online search landscape, potentially offering users a fresh alternative to traditional search engines.
newTitle: OpenAI Challenges Google: ChatGPT Search Now Free for All Users

title: Realme 14x 5G, Poco M7 Pro, CMF Phone 1, and more: Best smartphones to buy under Rs 15,000 in 2025 - The Financial Express
summary:
Best Smartphones Under Rs 15,000 in 2025

Date: Today
Source: Financial Express

The Realme 14x 5G is set to launch in India, offering great value for budget-conscious buyers with a mix of durability and features, though it comes with a 720p display. Other notable options include the Poco M7 Pro, CMF Phone 1, Xiaomi Redmi 13, and Vivo T3x, all priced under Rs 15,000, ensuring users get quality technology without breaking the bank.

Key Points:

  • Realme 14x 5G: Features a 6.67-inch 120Hz display, MediaTek Dimensity 6300 processor, and rugged build for Rs 14,999.
  • Poco M7 Pro: Offers a 6.67-inch 1080p AMOLED display, MediaTek Dimensity 7025 Ultra, and a 50MP dual-camera for Rs 14,999.
  • CMF Phone 1: Unique design with 6.67-inch AMOLED display and dual camera setup, priced from Rs 14,999.
  • Redmi 13 5G: Includes a 6.79-inch display and powerful Snapdragon 4 Gen 2 processor, from Rs 13,999.
  • Vivo T3x 5G: Features a 6.72-inch display, a Snapdragon 6 Gen 1 processor, and various RAM/storage options starting at Rs 13,499.
“The Realme 14x blends affordability with features appealing to young consumers.”

This list highlights excellent smartphones that provide high functionality at affordable prices, catering to the growing demand in the budget segment.
newTitle: Best Smartphones Under Rs 15,000 in 2025: Realme 14x 5G, Poco M7 Pro, and More

Google Drive Document Scanner gets AI-powered Auto Enhancement feature - India TV News
summary:
Google Drive Document Scanner gets AI-powered Auto Enhancement feature

Publication Date: Not specified Source: India TV News

Google has upgraded its Drive Document Scanner tool on Android with a new feature called "auto enhancements", aiming to improve the resolution and image quality of digitized documents. This feature will be available to both Google Workspace users and personal Google account holders.

  • The Auto Enhancements feature enhances scanned documents by addressing common issues like poor lighting and contrast.
  • It provides automatic suggestions for improvements, ensuring scanned documents appear clearer and more professional.
  • The feature supports files saved as PDFs or JPEGs, enhancing user utility.
  • This rollout follows several recent updates to Google Drive’s mobile scanner.
  • The auto enhancements feature will start rolling out to users in early January 2025.
“Once the feature is rolled out, it will work automatically after a document is scanned, simplifying the process for users.”

This upgrade is part of Google's continuous efforts to enhance the functionality of its scanning tool, making document management more efficient for users.
newTitle: Google Drive Document Scanner gets AI-powered Auto Enhancement feature

title: Realme 14x 5G launched in India with IP69 rating and 6,000 mAh battery - The Hindu
summary:
Realme 14x 5G launched in India with IP69 rating and 6,000 mAh battery

Date: December 18, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Realme has launched the Realme 14x 5G smartphone in India, featuring high water resistance and a large battery capacity.

  • First smartphone in the segment with IP68 and IP69 water resistance.
  • 6.67 inch display with a 120 Hz refresh rate and 625 nits brightness.
  • 6,000 mAh battery with a 45 W charger included.
  • Powered by MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chipset with up to 8 GB RAM and 128 GB storage.
  • Runs on Realme UI 5.0 based on Android 14.
  • 50 MP rear camera and 8 MP front camera.
  • Available in Crystal Black, Golden Glow, and Jewel Red colors.
  • Price: 6 GB/128 GB variant at ₹14,999 and 8 GB/128 GB variant at ₹15,999.
“The mid-segment phone brings features like sonicwave water ejection and rainwater smart touch.”

The Realme 14x 5G offers robust features for a mid-range smartphone, focusing on durability and performance.
newTitle: Realme 14x 5G Launched in India with IP69 Rating and 6,000 mAh Battery

title: Poco M7 Pro 5G launched under Rs 15,000: 4 reasons to buy, 1 to skip - India Today
summary:
Poco M7 Pro 5G launched under Rs 15,000: 4 reasons to buy, 1 to skip

Published On: Dec 18, 2024 | Published By: Aman Rashid

The Poco M7 Pro 5G is an affordable smartphone in the sub-Rs 15,000 price segment, offering impressive features like a 120Hz display and good performance while having some limitations regarding software support.

Key Points:

  • A stunning 120Hz display: 6.67-inch FHD+ AMOLED with peak brightness of 2,100 nits.
  • Sleek and lightweight design: Comfortable to hold with a plastic back and vibrant colors.
  • Reliable performance and battery life: MediaTek Dimensity 7025 Ultra processor with a 5110mAh battery and 45W fast charging.
  • 50MP camera with OIS: Primary camera for high-quality photos with optical image stabilization.

1 reason to skip:

Limited software support: Promises only two years of OS updates and does not ship with the latest Android version.

title: Apple reveals most downloaded apps, games from App Store in India in 2024 - The Hindu
summary:
Apple Reveals Most Downloaded Apps and Games in India for 2024

Published: December 18, 2024 12:56 pm IST

Source: The Hindu

Apple has revealed the most downloaded apps and games in 2024 from their App Store in India. WhatsApp leads as the most popular free app, while the Forest: Focus on Productivity app ranks as the top paid app.

  • Top free app: WhatsApp
  • Top paid app: Forest: Focus on Productivity
  • Other paid apps: Money Manager, DSLR Camera, Shadowrocket, iTabla Pro, Voice Recorder
  • Top free games: BGMI, Ludo King, Subway Surfers, Candy Crush Saga, Zupee
  • Top paid game: Minecraft
  • Apple Arcade highlights: Getting Over It+, NBA 2K24 Arcade Edition, Snake.io+, Asphalt 8: Airborne+, Angry Birds Reloaded
“Meta’s WhatsApp is the most popular free app among iPhone users.”

These rankings showcase the popular trends in app usage among iPhone users in India for 2024, reflecting both social media engagement and gaming interests.
newTitle: Apple Reveals Most Downloaded Apps and Games in India for 2024

title: After a year-long pause, GSV Ventures looks to invest in Indian edtechs in 2025 | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
GSV Ventures to Re-Enter Indian Edtech Market in 2025

Date & Source: Mumbai, Mint

After a year-long absence from Indian edtech startups, GSV Ventures is preparing to invest again in the Indian market, as revealed by Deborah Quazzo, managing partner at GSV Ventures.

GSV Ventures, known for investing exclusively in edtech companies globally, is set to finalize two new deals, including one in India, expected to be announced in 2025.

Key Points:

  • GSV Ventures has stayed away from Indian edtech for a year.
  • Plans to announce two new investment deals in 2025.
  • Focus remains solely on the edtech sector worldwide.
“After staying away from Indian edtech startups for a year, GSV Ventures is warming up to the Indian market again.” - Deborah Quazzo

The re-engagement in the Indian edtech space marks a significant development, as GSV Ventures looks to capitalize on emerging opportunities in a rapidly evolving educational landscape.
newTitle: GSV Ventures to Re-Enter Indian Edtech Market in 2025

title: Google rolls out Gemini 2.0 Flash and Gemini-Exp-1206 - The Hindu
summary:
Google Introduces Gemini 2.0 Flash and Experimental AI Model Gemini-Exp-1206

Published: December 18, 2024 11:01 am IST | Source: The Hindu

Google is rolling out new experimental AI models, inviting Gemini Advanced users to explore Gemini-Exp-1206, which promises improved performance in coding, math, and reasoning tasks.

  • Gemini-Exp-1206 offers enhanced performance for complex coding and mathematical tasks.
  • Users can access this model via the Gemini model drop-down on both desktop and mobile platforms.
  • Limitations may include unpredictable responses and restricted real-time information access.
  • Last week, Google also launched the Gemini 2.0 Flash model, aiming for improved assistant features.
  • A model-switching feature is being rolled out for Android app users.
“Whether you’re tackling complex coding challenges, solving mathematical problems for school or personal projects, or providing detailed, multi-step instructions to craft a tailored business plan, Gemini-Exp-1206 will help you navigate complex tasks with greater ease.” - Patrick Kane, Google

As generative AI tools evolve, users should be cautious as new models may not always yield reliable or accurate answers.
newTitle: Google Introduces Gemini 2.0 Flash and Experimental AI Model Gemini-Exp-1206
